summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Verizon Communications, demanding extensive telephone records for specific numbers from July 6, 2019 onward. The subpoena is part of a criminal investigation into suspected felonies, and the government requests confidentiality to preserve the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena to Verizon Communications as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for Verizon
events.description: Verizon Communications is commanded to appear before the Grand Jury in the Southern District of New York to testify and produce records, though appearance can be avoided by producing records by this date.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to Verizon
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to Verizon Communications for telephone records related to an ongoing criminal investigation.

locations: 180 Washington Valley Road, Bedminister, NJ 07921 (Verizon Communications address)
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY (Grand Jury location)
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The subpoena targets telephone records for specific numbers from July 6, 2019, onward, indicating an active investigation at that time.
The requested records are extensive, including subscriber info, billing details, call logs, text message data, and device identifiers.
The government explicitly requests Verizon to keep the subpoena confidential to avoid interfering with the investigation.
The subpoena references potential violations of federal statutes including conspiracy (18 U.S.C. ยง 371), false statements (ยง 1001), and destruction of records (ยง 1519).
